Interface ViewInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    View
    public interface ViewInterface
    Interface for the View. The view handles user interface elements and presentation logic. It provides visual representations of portfolio data and interacts with users through a command-line interface (CLI)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayPortfolioValue​(java.lang.String portfolioName, java.lang.String date, float value)
      Prints the name of a portfolio and its value on a certain date, and prints the date.
      void examineComposition​(Portfolio p)
      Prints the portfolio name, and lists each stock and the amount of that stock in the portfolio.
      void showTickerMatches​(java.lang.String csvContents)
      The user can look up ticker symbols that match the name of a company, or all ticker symbols that start with the inputted string.

    • Method Detail

      • examineComposition

        void examineComposition​(Portfolio p)
        Prints the portfolio name, and lists each stock and the amount of that stock in the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        p - the name of the portfolio

      • showTickerMatches

        void showTickerMatches​(java.lang.String csvContents)
        The user can look up ticker symbols that match the name of a company, or all ticker symbols that start with the inputted string. Elsewhere the program will query Alpha Vantage for a list of matching results. This method will display the top ticker symbols output by Alpha Vantage.
        Parameters:
        csvContents - data in csv format of the ticker symbol matches for a user query. The columns output by Alpha Vantage are symbol, name, type, region, marketOpen, marketClose, timezone, currency, and matchScore.

      • displayPortfolioValue

        void displayPortfolioValue​(java.lang.String portfolioName,
                           java.lang.String date,
                           float value)
        Prints the name of a portfolio and its value on a certain date, and prints the date.
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - the name of the portfolio that the list command was run on.
        date - the date that the value of the portfolio was determined for. MM/DD/YYYY format.
        value - the total value of the portfolio.
